disclaimer: This is informational only. Contact the court directly for current procedures.

court.name: Essex County Superior Court - Special Civil Part
court.address: 50 West Market Street, 4th Floor, Newark, NJ 07102
court.parking: Street parking and nearby garages; accessible by NJ Transit

clerkOffice.name: Special Civil Part Clerk's Office
clerkOffice.address: 50 West Market Street, 4th Floor, Newark, NJ 07102

complaintForPossession.filingLocation: Special Civil Part Clerk's Office, 4th Floor
requiredDocuments: Copy of notice served on tenant

serviceOfProcess.timeline: At least 10 days before trial date

answer.deadline: Before hearing date (can be filed at hearing)
answer.recommended: File at least 3 business days before hearing

checkIn.description: Check docket in hallway; find your courtroom
checkIn.arrivalTime: At least 30 minutes before scheduled time

continuances.policy: May be granted for good cause
continuances.method: Request from judge at hearing or motion

newarkProgram.name: Newark Right to Counsel Program
newarkProgram.description: Free legal representation for income-eligible tenants facing eviction
howToApply: Contact Legal Services of New Jersey: 1-888-576-5529

legalAidResources.name: Legal Services of New Jersey - Essex Region
legalAidResources.address: 60 Evergreen Place, Suite 400, East Orange, NJ 07018

legalAidResources.name: Rutgers Law School - Civil Justice Clinic
Seton Hall Law School - Center for Social Justice

rentalAssistance.name: Newark Department of Health & Community Wellness

specialNotes: Newark has the Right to Counsel program for income-eligible tenants
Strongest tenant protections in the nation apply
Good cause required for ALL evictions
Court is accessible by NJ Transit (Newark Penn Station)
Security screening required at building entrance
proceduralTips: Apply for legal aid as soon as you receive notice
Payment of ALL rent before judgment stops eviction
Bring all documentation organized and ready
Arrive early to find parking and navigate building
Know your rights under the Anti-Eviction Act
